channel.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?
channel.description:
I've been wondering, is it possible to re-create the mod "Sweet Half-Life" with Black Mesa utilities?
For those who don't know, "Sweet Half-Life" is a mod for the original GoldSrc Half-Life. It's pretty neat, with over-the-top scenes, and a little anime-ish. But the mod itself is pretty complex, and I'm wondering if it's actually [i]possible[/i] to re-make it.
If this is in the wrong section, please inform me about it.

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Yeah, just no consistent assets between them.

Read full topic

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?

item.description:
They’re both in Source 2007 Engine.

Read full topic

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Yes, but it’s not made with Black Mesa.

Read full topic
item.source: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: Shadowman60
item.description:
Kaweebo:

Yeah, exactly. There were TWO Blue Shift mods made in Black Mesa, actually. I’m not saying it’s the right thing to do, I’m just surprised no one has tried remaking OP4 in Black Mesa.

Wait, isn’t Operation: Black Mesa an OP4 remake? Or is that its own engine?

Read full topic
item.source: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
That’s probably the reason. You don’t really need Black Mesa’s codebase in order to remake Blue Shift.

Read full topic
item.source: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Kaweebo:

Yeah, exactly. There were TWO Blue Shift mods made in Black Mesa, actually. I’m not saying it’s the right thing to do, I’m just surprised no one has tried remaking OP4 in Black Mesa.

Well to be fair, OP4 isn’t as easily done in BM as BS because it requires a bunch of new weapons and NPCs, so that could be one reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?

item.description:
I’m just wondering how people haven’t done this, already. C’mon, how is there STILL not an Opposing Force Black Mesa mod in the works?

Read full topic
item.source: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?
item.dc:creator: Shadowman60
item.description:
JeffMOD:

There are also custom weapons and NPCs, which would not be possible using Black Mesa’s codebase, so unless the devs release the source code (Which they may after the final release, they have debated it IIRC) you’ll have to code the entire game from scratch.

Ah, well…

It was a pretty long shot anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?

There are also custom weapons and NPCs, which would not be possible using Black Mesa’s codebase, so unless the devs release the source code (Which they may after the final release, they have debated it IIRC) you’ll have to code the entire game from scratch.

item.title: Sweet Black Mesa - Is It Possible?

item.description:
